title: Avengers' Paul Rudd disappointed Thanos butt theory didn't happen
text:
Paul Rudd has shared his thoughts on the Endgame butt theory (Picture: WireImage)

With the dawn of Avengers: Endgame on us earlier this year, there was one particular Thanos/Ant-Man theory that had been put out there.

It was magical and beautiful and now Paul Rudd has revealed his disappointment it never came off.

The theory was first posited in 2017 before Infinity War had even been released and fans were pondering how the Avengers could defeat Thanos before he succeeded in collecting the five Infinity stones and received the power to destroy half the universe’s population.

There were two options chatted about in fan forums.

The first one being Ant-Man flying up Thanos’s butt and basically exploding the mad Titan from the inside out.

Fans felt they had a way to stop him (Picture: Rex Features)

The other was a little more gory as it explored the other end of his nethers: ‘They put the Hulk in an Ant-man suit. He shrinks down and makes his way into Thanos’s mouth. Then it’s just a waiting game. As soon as the Hulk makes it to the urethra he turns his suit off,’ one fan argued.

‘Thanos’s manhood explodes as a blood-covered Hulk emerges from the bloody mess. Thanos falls down unconscious and slowly bleeds to death.’

It’s all quite gory, right?

While producers of the film might have laughed off the theory, Paul was more keen for it.

Ant-Man to the rescue (Picture: Rex Features)

The star recently appeared on First We Feast’s Hot Ones promoting his new Netflix series Living With Yourself.

Because you can’t get an Avenger in a room and not ask about the Marvel Cinematic Universe, the star was pressed on his thoughts on the intriguing theory.

Paul paused, with a deep sigh, so thoughtful, and replied: ‘I consider it a lost opportunity.’

The star had previously shared his thoughts on the whole ‘going into Thanos’s butt’ thing, wondering why it had to be that particular orifice.

‘A lot of people have asked me recently if I shrink down and go… into Thanos, in a certain orifice, and then grow giant size. But why not the ear or the nose? Why does it have to be [that]?’ he said earlier this year during an appearance on The Graham Norton Show, making a fair point.

Before the release, Executive Producer Trinh Tran told Metro.co.uk she had seen your theories and while she admitted there are some that come close to revealing the ending of the film, this butt-tastic one wasn’t one of them.

‘One I recently read has been interesting, I won’t say much but it involved Thanos and Ant-Man,’ Trinh said in April.

‘It’s crazy, but it’s a lot of fun to see how people are coming up with crazy theories.’
